intro: Cliffortia serrata, commonly known as the serrated cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white, often in spring. Its leaves are pinnate and typically have a serrated edge, giving it its scientific name. Cliffortia serrata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found growing on cliffs or slopes.
